abstract: Metropolitan Transportation Authority Chairman Thomas F Prendergast moves to reassure New Yorkers alarmed about potential slump in service due to $15 billion gap in agency's five-year capital plan; says transit officials and elected leaders are in talks about how to find alternative funding or pare down costs.
lead_paragraph: Thomas F. Prendergast said major construction plans and renovations for the system could be in jeopardy if a $15 billion hole is not addressed.

headline.main: M.T.A. Chief Tries to Ease Alarm on Budget Gap, but Warns of Risks to Projects
headline.print_headline: M.T.A. Leader Tries to Ease Alarm on Budget Gap, but Warns of Risks to Projects

snippet: Thomas F. Prendergast said major construction plans and renovations for the system could be in jeopardy if a $15 billion hole is not addressed.
